questions.question: Which organization is often called the “world parliament”?
questions.explanation: The United Nations General Assembly is often called the 'world parliament' as it is where all member states have a seat and vote.

questions.question: The headquarters of the European Union (EU) is located in:
questions.explanation: The main headquarters of the European Union is in Brussels.

questions.question: Which two countries share the world’s longest international border?
questions.explanation: The United States and Canada share the longest international border.

questions.question: The World Trade Organization (WTO) sets rules for international trade to prevent disputes. It was established in which year?
questions.explanation: The World Trade Organization was established in 1995.

questions.question: The G7 group of nations is primarily made up of:
questions.explanation: The G7 is a group of major advanced economies.

questions.question: The Cold War was primarily a rivalry between:
questions.explanation: The Cold War was a geopolitical rivalry between the United States and the Soviet Union (USSR).

questions.question: BRICS is an alliance of which countries?
options: Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa
questions.explanation: BRICS is an alliance of Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa.

questions.question: Which country officially exited the European Union in 2020 (“Brexit”)?
questions.explanation: The United Kingdom officially exited the European Union in 2020.

questions.question: The Belt and Road Initiative (BRI) is a global infrastructure project launched by:
questions.explanation: The Belt and Road Initiative is a global infrastructure project launched by China.

questions.question: NATO was formed in which year?
questions.explanation: NATO was formed in 1949.

questions.question: The South China Sea disputes mainly involve:
questions.explanation: The disputes in the South China Sea are primarily over territorial claims.

questions.question: The OPEC organization is primarily concerned with:
questions.explanation: The OPEC organization is concerned with the production and price of oil.

questions.question: The Camp David Accords (1978) brought peace talks between which two Middle Eastern nations?
questions.explanation: The Camp David Accords were a peace treaty between Israel and Egypt.

questions.question: Which of the following countries is NOT a permanent member of the UN Security Council?
questions.explanation: Germany is not a permanent member of the UN Security Council.

questions.question: The Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) was founded during which period?
questions.explanation: The Non-Aligned Movement was founded during the Cold War.

questions.question: The Yalta Conference (1945) involved which leaders?
questions.explanation: The Yalta Conference involved Winston Churchill, Joseph Stalin, and Franklin Roosevelt.

questions.question: The Sykes–Picot Agreement (1916) secretly divided territories of which empire?
questions.explanation: The Sykes–Picot Agreement secretly divided the territories of the Ottoman Empire.

questions.question: The term “Iron Curtain” was popularized by:
questions.explanation: The term 'Iron Curtain' was popularized by Winston Churchill.

questions.question: Which two countries fought the Falklands War in 1982?
questions.explanation: The Falklands War was fought between the UK and Argentina.

questions.question: The Cuban Missile Crisis was triggered by Soviet missiles being placed in:
questions.explanation: The Cuban Missile Crisis was triggered by Soviet missiles being placed in Cuba.

questions.question: The Oslo Accords (1993) aimed at resolving conflict between:
questions.explanation: The Oslo Accords aimed to resolve the conflict between Israel and Palestine.

questions.question: Which doctrine justified U.S. intervention in Latin America during the Cold War?
questions.explanation: The Monroe Doctrine justified U.S. intervention in Latin America.

questions.question: The Bandung Conference (1955) was the first large-scale meeting of:
questions.explanation: The Bandung Conference was the first large-scale meeting of Asian and African states.

questions.question: The concept of “Mutually Assured Destruction (MAD)” is associated with:
questions.explanation: The concept of MAD is a nuclear strategy.

questions.question: The Marshall Plan (1948) was aimed at rebuilding which region?
questions.explanation: The Marshall Plan was aimed at rebuilding Western Europe after World War II.

questions.question: Which country controls the strategically important Strait of Hormuz?
questions.explanation: Iran controls the Strait of Hormuz.

questions.question: The “One China Policy” mainly concerns the political status of:
questions.explanation: The 'One China Policy' concerns the political status of Taiwan.

questions.question: The Organisation of African Unity (OAU), now replaced by the African Union (AU), was established in:
questions.explanation: The OAU was established in 1963.

questions.question: The Truman Doctrine was primarily designed to contain:
questions.explanation: The Truman Doctrine was a policy to contain the spread of communism.

questions.question: The Good Friday Agreement (1998) sought to bring peace in which region?
questions.explanation: The Good Friday Agreement sought to bring peace to Northern Ireland.
